title: Kamakura + Enoshima
content:
Today we left Tokyo, stopping at Kamakura and Enoshima on the way to our next hotel.

Unfortunately we lost a bit of time getting parked near Kotokuin Temple (where the giant Bronze Buddha resides), so we only had enough time to explore the grounds and the Buddha a little, and get a quick glimpse of the busy main street down from it. We managed to snag a coffee from a small place with Australian manuka honey for sale before we had to meet up and jump on the bus again.

Our next stop was Enoshima island, and this one we reached on time. Being an island, the local food options were mostly seafood, which we were happy to try. We stopped in at a place which was nice and lively and each had something delicious again.

We had enough time after lunch to do a little exploring - we all started on the over-island trek, but it was a lot of climbing steps, so not wanting to ruin themselves, most opted not to continue. I was keen to try and reach the caves entrance on other side, so picked up the pace and got going. I'm glad I did, as the views at the top and on the other side were awesome! Shrines and restaurants were scattered along the trail with some spectacular outlooks over the sea, and seeing Mt Fuji over the water was really cool.

Then it was back to the bus and on to our next hotel.
